intro: Spiesia humifusa, commonly known as the groundsel or lesser groundsel, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is a low-growing perennial with pale yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant typically has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and thrives in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. Spiesia humifusa is native to North America and is often found in areas with rich, sandy soils. Its botanical features make it a characteristic species of wetland and early successional plant communities.
